mcqs.question: Who is the poet of the poem 'The Twins'?

options.B: form and feature, face and limb

mcqs.question: Why were people confused about the twins?
What mistake happened during the naming ceremony?
Why was the speaker punished at school?

short_answers.question: The Twins short answer question 1.
short_answers.answer: The poem describes two identical twin brothers. They looked so alike that no one could tell them apart. This similarity caused many humorous problems in their lives. The poet uses humour and exaggeration to entertain the readers.

long_answers.question: The Twins long answer question 1.
long_answers.answer: ‘The Twins’ is a humorous poem written by Henry Sambrooke Leigh. The poem talks about two brothers who look exactly alike in every way. Because of their identical appearance, people often mistook one for the other. At birth, even the nurse confused them and gave them wrong names. This confusion followed the speaker throughout his life. At school, the speaker was punished for the mistakes of his brother. Later in life, even his bride became his brother’s wife due to confusion. The poem ends humorously when the wrong twin is buried after death. The poet uses exaggeration and humour to highlight the absurdity of the situation.

long_answers.question: The Twins long answer question 2.

Because of their identical appearance, people often mistook one for the other. At birth, even the nurse confused them and gave them wrong names. This confusion followed the speaker throughout his life. At school, the speaker was punished for the mistakes of his brother. Later in life, even his bride became his brother’s wife due to confusion. The poem ends humorously when the wrong twin is buried after death. The poet uses exaggeration and humour to highlight the absurdity of the situation.
